page.title: 18THE PLANTATION
page.content: THE PLANTATION SOMETIMES IT IS CALLED THE WOODS.WE WENT FOR A WALK THROUGH IT WITH OUR TEACHER AND MR. CARRUTHERS. LEAVING SCHOOL WE WALKED PAST THE FORGE,ACROSS THE FIELD,AND WATCHED SPARROW HAWKS DIVING FOR THEIR PREY.LOTS OF RABBITS WERE NEAR THE HEDGES.BY THE PATH ,WE SAW BUTTERCUPS DAISIES, DANDELIONS AND SPEEDWELL.AS WE WALKED ALONG THE OLD RAILWAY TRACK WE SAW POPPIES,CLOVER AND WILD HOPS. MR.CARRUTHERS SHOWED US HOW THE BIRDS HID THEIR NESTS IN THE HEDGES,AND WHERE THE FALLOW DEER HAD EATEN THE BARK OFF SOME YOUNG TREES. NEAR THE LOCK THERE WERE COOTS,GREBE, AND MOORHENS,BUT I DID NOT SEE A HERON THIS TIME.DOWN AT THE MILL POND WE SAW A SWAN'S NEST AND FIVE CYGNETS.
